title: Hanna Neumann conjecture
summary: In the mathematical subject of group theory, the Hanna Neumann conjecture is a statement about the rank of the intersection of two finitely generated subgroups of a free group. The conjecture was posed by Hanna Neumann in 1957.[1] In 2011, a strengthened version of the conjecture (see below) was proved independently by Joel Friedman[2] and by Igor Mineyev.[3]
